title: Food for Life Vrindavan

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Children,Drinking Water,Education & Literacy,Environment & Forests,Vocational Training,Women's Development & Empowerment

detailsOfAchievement: Food for Life Vrindavan is dedicated to serving the poorest of the poor residents of Vrindavan since 1990 particularly girls and women by providing comprehensive, essential human services which empower them to pursue fulfilling lives and become exemplary members of society, and by protecting the natural environment in which they live. Our work includes free meal distribution, providing water wells for villages which have no access to drinking water, Care for cows, Medical camps, Environment projects, Cleaning and Planting trees, a Paper Recycling factory, an Organic farm, Sewing and Embroidery Centre providing employment opportunity for village women. Most prominently, however, FFLV provides free education for over 1,300 girls who could not otherwise attend school. For the past 25 years Food For Life Vrindavan has been working in Vrindavan area. We have noticed that many of the young girls studying in our schools have faced intense hardship in the form of child marriage, child labour and other forms of abuse in which young girls are forced into adult roles at an early age. To prevent this we introduced the Sponsorship Program. It is a unique innovative programme that is aimed at preventing child marriage and keeping the young girls in school until the age of 18 through an incentivised scheme. A girl can be sponsored at $45 per month. Out of $45, $40 is used towards their education, uniform, meals, skill development, medical care etc. At the same time it confronts the issue of child marriage on multiple fronts, providing free insurance, guidance, and incentivizing the girls and their parents to pursue education. Each month as the girl attends school, $5 is held per month in a special fund until the girl is 18 years old. After which she will get the funds and be able to choose how she would like to spend it. Education is proven to pave a pathway to employment, enabling the girls to explore alternative life choices to early marriage. It would also benefit the family by ending the cycle of poverty. FFLV has received the following awards for its work till date: On the 14th of December 2016, Food for Life Vrindavan received the Swayam Award 2016. The award was given by the honourable CM of Uttar Pradesh, Mr. Akhilesh Yadav. The award ceremony was organised by Gaon Connection Foundation. Food for Life Vrindavan has been awarded certificate of excellence in the field of Girl Education by Bharat Vikas Parishad, in year 2016 Rupa Raghunath Das (Founder FFLV) was awarded Human Achievers Award for the year 2012 by the Human Achievers foundation in India. The award was given based on the revolutionary work Rupa Raghunath has done in the field of empowering women and children of the Braj area, transcending racial, national and religious barriers. Rupa Raghunath (Founder FFLV) won the Life Time Achievement award for the year 2006, awarded by the Indian Institute of Human Rights. Food For Life Vrindavan received the 8th World Human Rights Promotional Award for the year 2006. FFLV-Social Development Department received the 6th World Human Rights Promotional Award on the occasion of the World Human Right Congress held on 10th December 2004 at New Delhi, India.

title: FOUNDATION FOR KRISHNA KALA AND EDUCATION SOCIETY
detailsOfAchievement: Founded in the year 2001 with great passion by Ms Anu Sinha, the Foundation for Kirshna Kala and Education society is a temple of dance and music. The Society provides a platform to learn, perform, teach and gain education in all forms of performing arts. It is well equipped with experienced resources and associations with accredited institutions for certification courses. Focus on mentoring, training, guiding young disciples across age groups. Acclaimed for building confidence of disciples through sincere practice and dedication to deliver enthralling performances. Consistent efforts to establish new opportunities in diverse fields of dance and music. Ms Anu Sinha is very passionate about promoting self reliance among women. The Academy promotes yoga courses, which facilitates high mobility for performing arts. The Academy works as a multi-dimensional learning facility to promote art and culture through different art forms. To encourage talent, students are given several on stage performance opportunities to showcase their talent and learning. To materialize the vision of bringing dance and music to the reach of common and deserving people of the society and help the underprivileged. To provide vocational education to children and adults. To form an old age home for the destitute parents who are driven out by their children. To form a Yoga and Meditation centre for helping today generation in their pursuit of self-realization. To establish libraries with all types of books for all people of all ages. All the incomes, earnings, movable or immovable properties of the society shall be utilized and applied towards the promotion of its aim and objectives only. No profit shall be paid transferred directly, indirectly to any member of the foundation. To entertain, develop an interest and educate the upcoming generation about our multi ethnic heritage. To bring forth enhanced exposure, awareness and appreciation to the rich legacy of Indias ancient and diverse culture. In the ever westernizing ethos that our younger generation is dithering, we have the responsibility to inculcate, sustain and keep alive our glorious past. To organize at least four cultural events in a year. To organize global workshops to take India to the worlds. To provide stage and promote talent from all over the country and world.

title: FRIENDS OF HANDICAPPED INDIA
detailsOfAchievement: VAANI SCHOOL AND RESEARCH CENTRE FOR THE HEARING IMPAIRED AND MENTALLY RETARDED STUDENTS, ESTABLISHED IN 1997, IS PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY EDUCATION TOTALLY FREE TO ABOUT 180 STUDENTS FROM NURSERY TO CLASS XII. IT HAS STARTED HARNESSING TECHNOLOGY LIKE DIGITAL CLASSROOM TEACHING ON SMART BOARDS SO THAT THE DEAF CHILDREN MAY BE TRAINED AND EQUIPPED TO FACE THE CHALLENGES POSED BY THE TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES IN THIS AREA. THIS SCHOOL HAS BEEN AWARDED WITH BEST ORGANIZATION AWARD BY UTTAR PRADESH GOVT. IN 2009. VAANI HAS NOW STARTED A MULTIPURPOSE VOCATIONAL TRAINING CENTRE TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY VOCATIONAL TRAINING TO HANDICAPPED STUDNETS IN VARIOUS VOCATIONS SUCH AS COMPUTER COURSES, COMPUTER ACCOUNTING, FASHION DESIGNING, BEAUTICIANS COURSE AND JEWELLERY DESIGNING ETC.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
sourceOfFunds.purpose: This Institute is providing free education to Handicapped Students (Specially HI Students)up to Class XIIth Since 1997. It is accredited by the National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) Noida. Education is provided without any distinction of religion, Caste, Creed or Gender by highly motivated staff with the help of modern tools of education such as Digital Smart Class System, Speech Trainers, Computers and Group Hearing Aid System. At present there are 193 students (HI-179 and MR-14).

detailsOfAchievement: Future Institute of Education, Research and Development is leading india towards Youth Employment and Women Empowerment . This Organization has been working tirelessly to connect Indian Youth and Rural and Urban women to mainstream of India by self funded project. Women and men are being made aware by conducting branches in various areas through the organization. Apart from online computer literacy program and Sankalp program, the organization is conducting various vocational training also.
